page.title: 04ASSOCIATION WITH T.GRAY
page.content:
Many poets and writers have written about Burnham Beeches."Gray's Nodding Beech"is to commemorate Thomas Gray,the poet,1716/1771.He was said to have written "Elegy written in a Country Churchyard"under a yew tree in the churchyard of St.Giles in nearby Stoke Poges,Buckinghamshire. Here is a poem written by Thomas Gray about Burnham Beeches.....
"Over many a dell and upland walk, Their sylvan beauty reaches, Of Birnam wood let Scotland boast, While we've our Burnham Beeches!" _______ Other famous people have connections with Burnham Beeches,such as Chopin, Mendelssohn the composers.See page 5 for these.
